intro: Catoblastus distichus, commonly known as the two-leaved catoblastus, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically lanceolate in shape. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. The plant is adapted to grow in moist, tropical environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
